title: Ticket #1177: Drop support for HPUX/HP-UX
description:
1. Can we do it? Confirm that we have almost no users relying on HP-UX.
  2. Held existing users. Help existing users with migration plans away from HP-UX
  3. Make one-off only. In /src/nmi_glue/CondorTest.pm, move the entry 'hppa_hpux_11' from official_ports (around line 43) into nmi_one_offs (around line 63)
  4. Drop port entirely. When NMI is willing to do without HPUX...
    • delete 'hppa_hpux_11' from nmi_one_offs (/src/nmi_glue/CondorTest.pm around line 63)
    • delete the hppa_hpux_11 block (/src/nmi_glue/CondorTest.pm around line 270)
  5. Clean old ifdefs. Code that is only compiled for HPUX machines should be deleted. #defines used include IS_HPUX, HPUX, HPUX10, andHPUX11. You can find most, possibly all, of it using this: 
    find -type f -print0 | xargs -0 grep 'if.*HPUX'
  6. Close this ticket and be happy.
remarks:

Hrm, what do do about this ticket. hpux was dropped in the developer series in 7.5.2.

However, it still exists in the stable series for NMI.

So while part of this ticket is completed, another part is not. In lieu of this, I'm moving the fixed version to 7.5.3, even though a functionally important piece was completed.
